column1: B2004143-ECA6-482F-B9E2-07A6466BFB85#appfire#D4C4DBCD-3667-458E-BFD9-5429C93B9FFD#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire##appfire#2016-02-05 15:22:23.0#appfire##appfire#2016-02-05 15:22:23.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#C65BD2E7-3327-4668-8F41-997FB92D36F2#appfire#D4C4DBCD-3667-458E-BFD9-5429C93B9FFD#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire##appfire#2016-02-05 15:22:23.0#appfire##appfire#2016-02-05 15:22:23.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#D66A549C-2840-4672-A27D-9272E49D61DB#appfire#D4C4DBCD-3667-458E-BFD9-5429C93B9FFD#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire##appfire#2016-02-05 15:22:23.0#appfire##appfire#2016-02-05 15:22:23.0#appfire#1
